snippet: Jacoby Ellsbury has done well when third in the order — the spot of Ruth, Mantle, Mattingly and O’Neill — but he is known more for scoring runs than for driving them in.
abstract: Benjamin Hoffman Keeping Score column examines Jacob Ellsbury's performance batting third for the New York Yankees, spot that has been occupied by some of team's greatest players; argues that while Ellsbury has done well so far, his nature as a run-scorer makes him an odd choice for the slot.
lead_paragraph: Jacoby Ellsbury has done well when third in the order — the spot of Ruth, Mantle, Mattingly and O’Neill — but he is known more for scoring runs than for driving them in.

headline.main: Ellsbury Batting Third for Yankees Without Fitting Profile
headline.print_headline: Ellsbury, a Leadoff Man Batting Third
